description:
In restaurant finance, preparation and forecasting can open alternatives for performance optimization and driving market share gains to improve profitability.

We take a look at what’s down, what’s up, what’s the average ratio, and where the top-quartile performers are making a difference. We analyze by ownership type (fully corporate to 100% franchised), foodservice segments (QSR, Casual Dining, Fast-Casual, Fine Dining), chains-vs-independents, and across geographies so that you can gain insights into restaurant finance benchmarks and gap analysis.

We cover every line from the three financial statements from the viewpoint of what’s important for the restaurant industry: sales, royalties and franchise fees, food costs, labor costs, rent, utilities, EBITDA margins, interest rates, net income, cash flows, CAPEX, the balance sheet and more.
name: Restaurant Finance
